title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: members, contributors, leaders pledge make participation community harassment-free experience everyone, regardless age, body size, visible invisible disability, ethnicity, sex characteristics, gender identity expression, level experience, education, socio-economic status, nationality, personal appearance, race, caste, color, religion, sexual identity orientation. pledge act interact ways contribute open, welcoming, diverse, inclusive, healthy community.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Examples behavior contributes positive environment community include: Demonstrating empathy kindness toward people respectful differing opinions, viewpoints, experiences Giving gracefully accepting constructive feedback Accepting responsibility apologizing affected mistakes, learning experience Focusing best just us individuals, overall community Examples unacceptable behavior include: use sexualized language imagery, sexual attention advances kind Trolling, insulting derogatory comments, personal political attacks Public private harassment Publishing others’ private information, physical email address, without explicit permission conduct reasonably considered inappropriate professional setting

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community leaders responsible clarifying enforcing standards acceptable behavior take appropriate fair corrective action response behavior deem inappropriate, threatening, offensive, harmful. Community leaders right responsibility remove, edit, reject comments, commits, code, wiki edits, issues, contributions aligned Code Conduct, communicate reasons moderation decisions appropriate.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Code Conduct applies within community spaces, also applies individual officially representing community public spaces. Examples representing community include using official e-mail address, posting via official social media account, acting appointed representative online offline event.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Instances abusive, harassing, otherwise unacceptable behavior may reported community leaders responsible enforcement yaouhu@outlook.com. complaints reviewed investigated promptly fairly. community leaders obligated respect privacy security reporter incident.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community leaders follow Community Impact Guidelines determining consequences action deem violation Code Conduct:

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: Use inappropriate language behavior deemed unprofessional unwelcome community. Consequence: private, written warning community leaders, providing clarity around nature violation explanation behavior inappropriate. public apology may requested.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: violation single incident series actions. Consequence: warning consequences continued behavior. interaction people involved, including unsolicited interaction enforcing Code Conduct, specified period time. includes avoiding interactions community spaces well external channels like social media. Violating terms may lead temporary permanent ban.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: serious violation community standards, including sustained inappropriate behavior. Consequence: temporary ban sort interaction public communication community specified period time. public private interaction people involved, including unsolicited interaction enforcing Code Conduct, allowed period. Violating terms may lead permanent ban.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: Demonstrating pattern violation community standards, including sustained inappropriate behavior, harassment individual, aggression toward disparagement classes individuals. Consequence: permanent ban sort public interaction within community.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Code Conduct adapted Contributor Covenant, version 2.1, available https://www.contributor-covenant.org/version/2/1/code_of_conduct.html. Community Impact Guidelines inspired [Mozilla’s code conduct enforcement ladder][https://github.com/mozilla/inclusion]. answers common questions code conduct, see FAQ https://www.contributor-covenant.org/faq. Translations available https://www.contributor-covenant.org/translations.

title: Contributing to easyphysicsR
text: want type contributions package, please create GitHub issue repository inform us. please follow instructions different types contributions. outlines propose change easyphysicsR. detailed info contributing , tidyverse packages, please see development contributing guide.

title: Contributing to easyphysicsR
text: can fix typos, spelling mistakes, grammatical errors documentation directly using GitHub web interface, long changes made source file. generally means ’ll need edit roxygen2 comments .R, .Rd file. can find .R file generates .Rd reading comment first line.

title: Contributing to easyphysicsR
text: want make bigger change, ’s good idea first file issue make sure someone team agrees ’s needed. ’ve found bug, please file issue illustrates bug minimal reprex (also help write unit test, needed).

title: Contributing to easyphysicsR
text: Fork package clone onto computer. haven’t done , recommend using usethis::create_from_github("UBC-MDS/easyphysicsR", fork = TRUE). Install development dependencies devtools::install_dev_deps(), make sure package passes R CMD check running devtools::check(). R CMD check doesn’t pass cleanly, ’s good idea ask help continuing. Create Git branch pull request (PR). recommend using usethis::pr_init("brief-description--change"). Make changes, commit git, create PR running usethis::pr_push(), following prompts browser. title PR briefly describe change. body PR contain Fixes #issue-number. user-facing changes, add bullet top NEWS.md (.e. just first header). Follow style described https://style.tidyverse.org/news.html.

title: Contributing to easyphysicsR
text: New code follow tidyverse style guide. can use styler package apply styles, please don’t restyle code nothing PR. use roxygen2, Markdown syntax, documentation. use testthat unit tests. Contributions test cases included easier accept.

title: Contributing to easyphysicsR
text: Please note easyphysicsR project released Contributor Code Conduct. contributing project agree abide terms.

what: What the Package Does (One Line, Title Case)
title: What the Package Does (One Line, Title Case)
text: package useful physics formulas make physics easy fun users! uses four functions easily calculate four classic physics theories. making functions concise supporting graphs demonstrate theories, physics beginners might find learning physics fun daunting! functions package require arguments numeric format; dataset files needed. easyphysics can also generate easy--understand visualizations reveal physics effects.

title: What the Package Does (One Line, Title Case)
text: can install development version easyphysicsR GitHub :

title: What the Package Does (One Line, Title Case)
text: package four functions can provide solutions Physics Equations. Input taken User solutions provided functions. four functions follows: freefall() calculates time takes falling object using equation motion height = 1/2*gt^2, given height gravity free fall. returns time takes free fall, plot compares time free fall different planets list. distance traveled falling object (height) acceleration gravity (g, default g = 9.8) function’s arguments. gravitational_energy() calculates energy possessed acquired object due change position present gravitational field = mgh kinetic_energy() calculates Kinetic Energy object. work done object, energy transferred, object moves new constant speed. call energy transferred kinetic energy, depends mass speed achieved. kinetic energy equation given : KE = 1/2mv^2, KE kinetic energy, m body’s mass, v body’s velocity. static_friction_ground() calculates friction force static object. formula fr = mu * N, mu coefficient friction incorporating characteristics surface.
code: library(easyphysicsR) freefall(10, g = 9.8) #> [[1]] #> [1] 1.428571 #> [[2]] #> `geom_smooth()` using method = 'loess' and formula = 'y ~ x' easyphysicsR::freefall(10, g = 9.8) #> [[1]] #> [1] 1.428571 #> [[2]] #> `geom_smooth()` using method = 'loess' and formula = 'y ~ x' gravitational_energy(2.5,10,9.80665) #> 245.16 easyphysicsR::gravitational_energy(2.5,10,9.80665) #> 245.16 kinetic_energy(0.6, 3) #> 2.7 easyphysicsR::kinetic_energy(0.6, 3) #> 2.7 static_friction_ground(mu=0.2, g = 9.8, m=10) #> 19.6 easyphysicsR::static_friction_ground(mu=0.2, g = 9.8, m=10) #> 19.6

title: What the Package Does (One Line, Title Case)
text: Another similar physics package soilphysics available R ecosystem.soilphysics library soil physics data analysis. easyphysicsR targets physics beginners rather soil physics professionals, middle schoolers people new physics. uses four functions easily calculate four classic physics theories, limited soil physics. making functions concise supporting graphs demonstrate theories, physics beginners might find learning physics fun daunting! functions package require arguments numeric format; dataset files needed. easyphysicsR can also generate easy--understand visualizations reveal physics effects. specific functions visual components make easyphysicsR different packages.

title: What the Package Does (One Line, Title Case)
text: easyphysicsR created Revathy Ponnambalam, Nikita Susan Easow, Yaou Hu Mengjun Chen. Interested contributing? Check contributing guidelines. Please note project released Code Conduct. contributing project, agree abide terms.

what:
calculate the time it takes for a free fall based on
distance traveled by a falling object and the gravity of the free fall
using the equation of motion h = 1/2*gt^2. It also returns
a plot compares the time it takes for the free fall on different planets. — freefall
title:

text: GE Gravitational energy object

title: Kinetic Energy — kinetic_energy
text: Calculates Kinetic Energy object. work done object, energy transferred, object moves new constant speed. call energy transferred kinetic energy, depends mass speed achieved. kinetic energy equation given : KE = 1/2mv^2, KE kinetic energy, m body’s mass, v body’s velocity.

title: Kinetic Energy — kinetic_energy
text: m mass object (kg) v velocity object (m/s)

title: Kinetic Energy — kinetic_energy
text: KE kinetic energy object

what:
calculating the friction force for static object. The formula is fr = mu * N, where
the mu is the coefficient of friction which incorporating the characteristics of the surface.
For example, if you want to calculate the friction when you put your phone on a table, then the coefficient of friction is
depending on the matirial of the table. N is the normal force which means the perpendicular force of the surface which object
touching on. In our case, it would be m*g since it is on the ground. fr = mu * m * g. — static_friction_ground

N normal force means perpendicular force surface object touching . case, m*g since ground. fr = mu * m * g.

title:
calculating the friction force for static object. The formula is fr = mu * N, where
the mu is the coefficient of friction which incorporating the characteristics of the surface.
For example, if you want to calculate the friction when you put your phone on a table, then the coefficient of friction is
depending on the matirial of the table. N is the normal force which means the perpendicular force of the surface which object
touching on. In our case, it would be m*g since it is on the ground. fr = mu * m * g. — static_friction_ground
code: static_friction_ground(mu=0.2, g = 9.8, m=10) #> [1] 19.6 19.6 #> [1] 19.6 static_friction_ground(g=10, mu=0.2, m=2) #> [1] 4 4 #> [1] 4
